thread.title: Final US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia
thread.title_full: Final US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia

author: Tribune wire reports
title: Final US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia
text:
Final US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia Jose M. Osorio / Chicago Tribune 
A US Airways plane arrives at Terminal 3 at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Monday, Dec. 9, 2013. 
A US Airways plane arrives at Terminal 3 at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Monday, Dec. 9, 2013. (Jose M. Osorio / Chicago Tribune) Tribune wire reports Contact Reporter 
The final US Airways flight is taking off from Philadelphia and stopping in Charlotte, North Carolina, then Phoenix and San Francisco. 
Flight 1939, named for the airline's founding year, is scheduled to depart Philadelphia International Airport at 10:05 a.m. Friday and arrive in Charlotte about two hours later. 
The Airbus A321 will return to Philadelphia on Saturday under the American Airlines banner, following the completion of a merger announced in 2013. 
Pittsburghers were upset the flight wasn't stopping there. US Airways was formed in Pittsburgh as All American Aviation. It later operated as Allegheny Airlines before becoming USAir. 
US Airways dropped Pittsburgh as a hub in 2004 and American Airlines shut down its nearby flight operations control center in August, shifting about 650 jobs to Fort Worth, Texas. 
Associated Press
